sentences.en: Baby - linen - for babies then wore robes of state - afforded another possibility of toil and emolument.
sentences.cn: 而婴儿的服装 —— 当时的婴儿是穿袍服的 —— 也为她提供了依靠劳动获得收入的机会.

sentences.en: He could earn up to a million dollars a year in salary and emoluments from many directorships.
sentences.cn: 他每年可赚高达一百万美金的薪水另加担任多个董事职位的酬金。

sentences.en: He was paid a modest emolument.
The emolument of this profession is not satisfactory.
sentences.cn: 此行业的报酬不令人满意。

sentences.en: Typically, coating paper Toner low emolument and making quality and low.
sentences.cn: 通常, 涂层纸的墨粉定影强度较低且制卡质量低.

trans.tran_en: Emoluments are money or other forms of payment that a person receives for doing work
